page.title: 10 FARMING AROUND LITCHAM
page.content: A typical farmer grows wheat, barley, potatoes, beans and oil-seed rape. The soil he farms is light to heavy sand and it is moderately fertile. The soil compares favourably with soils in other parts of Norfolk. The average size of the fields is about 30 acres. The two labourers employed by the farmer both live locally. Most of the animal food is home-grown but pulp nuts are bought from the British Sugar factory as fodder for the cattle, and some feed is bought from the local feed merchants. Most of the farmers have tractors, a combine harvester, plough, seed drill ,harrow,a fertilizer spreader,baler,a sugarbeet harvester,potato harvester, trailers and rolls.
